properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 4:05AM EST until January 16 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Burlington VT
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as
25 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero.

* WHERE...Essex, Caledonia, and Washington Counties of Vermont.

* WHEN...The Winter Weather Advisory continues through 7 PM EST
tonight. The Wind Chill Advisory is valid from 4 AM to 10 AM EST
Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult during the morning commute
due to snow covered roads and low visibilities. Areas of blowing
snow this afternoon could significantly reduce visibility and
make for additional travel issues. The cold wind chills early
Friday morning could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as
little as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will continue across the area today
and will be moderate at times this morning. Snow intensity and
areal coverage will gradually decrease later today, but linger
into the evening hours with additional light accumulations
possible.
properties.instruction:
If traveling, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your
vehicle in case of an emergency. And please allow extra time if
traveling today. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves,
especially later tonight and early Friday when wind chills values
will be the coldest.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 AM EST FRIDAY
